intro: Primulina longzhouensis, commonly known as the Longzhou gloxinia, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb with fleshy, dark green leaves. It thrives in shady, humid environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural habitat.
